msContents.summary: F-2v: Image of Mary (an unusual form, Image of the flower?). F-34r: Canticle of the Flower, arranged by a later hand for the days of the week. F-47v: Lamentation of the Virgin. F-54v: Unidentified asmat prayer. F-63r: Unidentified asmat prayer, mentioning the story of the True Cross. F-73v: Unidentified asmat prayer. F-87v: Asmat prayer which Jesus gave to his disciples on Dabra Zait. F-94v: Asmat of Christ. F-102r: Asmat Prayer for Remission of Faith of the Disciples. F-109v: Asmat prayer that was given to the three Hebrew children. F-119v: Image of the Savior of the World. F and 47v mention the owner, Walda Iyasus Danachaw. : mentions the scribe, Walda Rufa'el. : record: completion of the book: dated 1918 EC in the year of Saint Mark, Nahase 3. : record, written in blue ink, of the sale of property. Buyer and seller are mentioned. Illuminations (verfy high quality): F. ii r(ecto) Madonna and Child, flanked by two angels holding a canopy over them. : Madonna and Child under a vine with leaves, aged man with cave to the right, soldier with spear in upper right. : God the Father, enthroned, surrounded by the four living creatures. : Crucifixion of Jesus Christ.
